docs.title: Material Deck DnD5e Documentation
docs.text:
Material Deck DnD5e Documentation

This documentation is for the Dungeons & Dragons 5e system module for Material Deck. Please refer to the Material Deck documentation for more info on Material Deck.

The Material Deck DnD5e system module adds DnD5e-dependent features to Material Deck to the following actions:

  • Combat Tracker
  • Other Actions
  • Token

docs.title: Changelog
docs.text:
Changes between module versions are documented here. This changelog is for v2+ only, for the pre v2 changelog click here.

v2.0.0 - 09-03-2025

docs.title: Combat Tracker Action
docs.text: The 'Combat Tracker' action has new Stats, On Press and On Hold options. These options are identical to the ones for the Token Mode of the 'Token' action.

docs.title: Other Actions
docs.text:
3 new functions are added to 'Other Actions':

  • Set Default Roll Modifier
  • Set Default Roll Type
  • Set Default Weapon Attack Mode

docs.title: Set Default Roll Modifier
docs.text: Using this function you can change the 'default roll modifier'. This roll modifier is applied to rolls in the Token Action if their Roll Modifier is set to Default.

docs.title: Modifier
docs.text:
You can configure a button to set the modifier to:

  • Normal: Perform a normal roll
  • Advantage: Perform a roll with advantage (roll twice, keep the highest)
  • Disadvantage: Perform a roll with disadvantage (roll twice, keep the lowest)

Say you have a 'Token Action' button set to:

  • Mode: Inventory
  • Selection options: Set to select a weapon
  • On Press: Use
  • Show Dialog: False
  • Roll Modifier: Default

If you then press a 'Set Default Roll Modifier' button set to Advantage and then press the 'Token Action' button, the selected weapon will roll with advantage. Similarly, if you have the 'Set Default Roll Modifier' button set to Disadvantage the weapon will roll with disadvantage.

docs.title: Set After Use To
docs.text:
With this setting you can configure what the default roll mode should be set to after performing a roll. For example, you might want it to always default to normal rolls, so you set it to Normal. If you have multiple 'Set Default Roll Modifier' buttons on the display, their Set After Use To setting will be the same for all.

Set After Use To is only applied when something is rolled that actually uses the default roll modifier.

docs.title: Set Default Roll Type
docs.text: Using this function you can change the 'default roll type'. This roll type is applied to rolls in the Token Action if their Roll Type is set to Default.

docs.title: Type
docs.text:
You can configure a button to set the type to:

  • Default: Perform a default roll, which for, for example, weapons, means an attack roll (with dialog)
  • Attack: Perform an attack roll
  • Damage: Perform a damage roll
  • Critial: Perform a critical damage roll
  • Use: Perform a use roll

Say you have a 'Token Action' button set to:

  • Mode: Inventory
  • Selection options: Set to select a weapon
  • On Press: Use
  • Show Dialog: False
  • Roll Type: Default

If you then press a 'Set Default Roll Type' button set to Attack and then press the 'Token Action' button, an attack roll will be performed for the weapon. Similarly, if you have the 'Set Default Roll Type' button set to Damage the roll will be a damage roll.

If the item you attempt to roll for is not able to perform a roll of the specified type, it will perform a default roll.

docs.title: Set After Use To
docs.text: Functions the same as for Set Default Roll Modifier.

docs.title: Set Default Weapon Attack Mode
docs.text: Using this function you can change the 'default weapon attack mode'. This mode is applied to rolls in the Token Action if their Attack Mode is set to Default.

docs.title: Mode
docs.text:
You can configure a button to set the mode to:

  • Default: Perform a default roll for the weapon, which is usually either 'One-Handed' or 'Two-Handed', but depends on the item
  • One-Handed: Perform an one-handed roll
  • Two-Handed: Perform a two-handed roll
  • Offhand: Perform an offhand roll
  • Thrown: Perform a thrown roll
  • Offhand Thrown: Perform an offhand thrown roll

Say you have a 'Token Action' button set to:

  • Mode: Inventory
  • Selection options: Set to select a versatile weapon
  • On Press: Use
  • Show Dialog: False
  • Roll Type: Attack
  • Attack Mode: Default

If you then press a 'Set Default Weapon Attack Mode' button set to One-Handed and then press the 'Token Action' button, a one-handed attack roll will be performed for the weapon. Similarly, if you have the 'Set Default Weapon Attack Mode' button set to Two-Handed the roll will be a two-handed attack roll.

If the weapon you attempt to roll for is not able to perform a roll of the specified mode, a notification will appear.

docs.title: Set After Use To
docs.text: Functions the same as for Set Default Roll Modifier.

docs.title: Token Action
docs.text:
The token action has extra features for the Token mode, and adds new modes:

  • Token Mode: New Stats, On Press and On Hold options
  • Inventory Mode: Display and roll weapons and other items
  • Features Mode: Display and roll actor features
  • Spellbook Mode: Display and roll spells

docs.title: Token Mode
docs.text:
The Token mode has new Stats, On Press and On Hold options.

Option Description Stats Stat to display:-HP-Temporary HP-AC-Speed-Initiative-Hit Dice-Spellcasting: Spellcasting ability, DC, modifier or spell slots.-Currency: All, or a specified type of currency.-Encumbrance-Ability Score: Ability score of a specified ability.-Ability Modifier: Ability modifier of a specified ability.-Saving Throw Bonus: Saving throw bonus of a specified ability.-Skill Bonus: Skill bonus of a specified skill.-Skill Passive: Passive score of a specified skill.-Proficiency Bonus-XP On Press/On Hold Sets what to do when the button is pressed/held down:-Toggle Condition: Toggle a specified condition or clear all conditions.-Dice Roll: Roll a dice for a specified feature.

docs.title: Dice Roll
docs.text:
Dice Roll allows you to roll a dice for the selected token/actor.

Option Description Roll Type of roll:-Initiative: Roll initiative (if in combat).-Ability Check: Roll an ability check.-Saving Throw: Roll a saving throw.-Skill Check: Roll a skill check. Ability(Ability Check &Saving Throw) Ability to roll. Skill(Skill Check) Skill to roll. Roll Modifier(All but Initiative) Roll modifier:-Default: Roll using the default roll modifier.-Normal: Normal roll.-Advantage: Roll with advantage (roll twice, take the highest).-Disadvantage: Roll with disadvantage (roll twice, take the lowest).

docs.title: Inventory Mode
docs.text:
The inventory mode can be used to display and control items in the token/actor's inventory.

Option Description Item Type -Any: Select any kind of item.-Weapons: Select from weapons.-Equipment: Select from equipment.-Consumables: Select from consumable items.-Tools: Select from tools.-Containers: Select from containers.-Loot: Select from loot.-Set Type & Filter Sync: Set the synced settings for this page. Will synchronize Item Type and Selection Filter.-Offset: Set item offsets. Selection Filter Selects item parameters to filter out:-Equipped: Filters equipped items.-Not Equipped: Filters unequipped items-Unequippable: Filters items that cannot be equipped.-Attuned: Filters attuned items.-Unattuned: Filters unattuned items. Sync Type & Filter Will synchronize Item Type and Selection Filter for all buttons on this page with this setting enabled. Selection Set how to select the item:-Select by Nr: Select an item using a number.-Select by Name/Id: Select an item using its name or id. Order(Select by Nr) Sets how to order the items:-Character Sheet: Follow the order of the character sheet.-Alphabetically: Order items alphabetically. Nr(Select by Nr) Number of the item to select. Name/Id(Select by Name/Id) Name or id of the item to select. On Press/On Hold Sets what to do when the button is pressed/held down:-Do Nothing: Do nothing.-Use: Use (roll) the item.-Equip: Equip or unequip the item.-Set Quantity: Set the quantity of the item.-Set Charges: Set the charges of the item. Mode(Equip) Configure what to do:-Toggle: Toggle between equipping and unequipping item.-Equip: Equip item.-Unequip: Unequip item. Mode(Set Quantity) Configure how to set the quantity:-Set to Value: Set to the specified value.-Increase/Decrease: Increase or decrease the quantity by the specified value. Mode(Set Charges) Configure how to set the charges:-Reset: Reset the charges.-Set to Value: Set to the specified value.-Increase/Decrease: Increase or decrease the quantity by the specified value. Display -Icon: Display item's icon.-Name: Display item's name.-Box: Display a box with data.-To Hit: Display the item's 'To Hit' modifier.-Damage: Display the item's damage formula.-Range: Display the item's range.

docs.title: Use Item
docs.text:
Using the On Press or On Hold Use Item function, you can use the item by pressing/holding the button.

Option Description Show Dialog Selected: Will show the roll dialog with all (applicable) options below pre-filled.Not selected: Will not show the roll dialog and roll the item according to the options below. Roll Modifier Sets the roll modifier:-Default: Roll using the default roll modifier.-Normal: Normal roll.-Advantage: Roll with advantage (roll twice, take the highest).-Disadvantage: Roll with disadvantage (roll twice, take the lowest). Roll Type Sets the roll type:-Default: Roll using the default roll type.-Attack: Perform an attack roll.-Damage: Perform a damage roll.-Critical: Perform a critical damage roll.-Use: Perform a 'use item' roll. Attack Mode Sets the attack mode:-Default: Roll using the default weapon attack mode.-One-Handed: Perform a one-handed roll.-Two-Handed: Perform a two-handed roll.-Offhand: Perform an offhand roll.-Thrown: Perform a thrown roll.-Offhand Throw: Perform an offhand throw roll.

docs.title: Features Mode
docs.text:
The features mode can be used to display and control token/actor features.

Option Description Features Type -Any: Select any kind of feature.-Classes: Select from classes.-Subclasses: Select from subclasses.-Backgrounds: Select from backgrounds.-Races: Select from races.-Abilities: Select from (all) abilities.-Active Abilities: Select from active abilities.-Passive Abilities: Select from passive abilities.-Set Type & Filter Sync: Set the synced settings for this page. Will synchronize Feature Type and Feature Type Filter.-Offset: Set feature offsets. Selection Filter Selects feature types to filter out:-Features: Filters feature features.-Class: Filters class features-Special: Filters special features.-Action: Filters action features.-Bonus Action: Filters bonus action features.-Reaction: Filters reaction features.-Legendary Actions: Filters legendary action features.-Mythic Actions: Filters mytic action features. Sync Type & Filter Will synchronize Feature Type and Feature Type Filter for all buttons on this page with this setting enabled. Selection Set how to select the feature:-Select by Nr: Select a feature using a number.-Select by Name/Id: Select a feature using its name or id. Order(Select by Nr) Sets how to order the features:-Character Sheet: Follow the order of the character sheet.-Alphabetically: Order features alphabetically. Nr(Select by Nr) Number of the feature to select. Name/Id(Select by Name/Id) Name or id of the feature to select. Display -Icon: Display feature's icon.-Name: Display feature's name.-Uses: Display the feature's uses.

docs.title: Spellbook Mode
docs.text:
The spellbook mode can be used to display and control token/actor spells.

Option Description Spell Type -Any: Select any kind of spell.-Cantrip/Level: Select from the specified spell level.-Set Type & Filter Sync: Set the synced settings for this page. Will synchronize Spell Type and Preparation Mode Filter.-Offset: Set item offsets. Preparation Mode Filter Filter Selects spell preparation modes to filter out:-Prepared: Filters prepared spells.-Always Prepared: Filters always prepared spells-Innate: Filters innate spells.-At Will: Filters at will spells.-Ritual: Filters ritual spells.-Pact Magic: Filters pact magic spells. Sync Type & Filter Will synchronize Spell Type and Preparation Mode Filter for all buttons on this page with this setting enabled. Selection Set how to select the spell:-Select by Nr: Select a spell using a number.-Select by Name/Id: Select a spell using its name or id. Order(Select by Nr) Sets how to order the spells:-Character Sheet: Follow the order of the character sheet.-Alphabetically: Order spells alphabetically. Nr(Select by Nr) Number of the spell to select. Name/Id(Select by Name/Id) Name or id of the spell to select. Display -Icon: Display spell's icon.-Name: Display spell's name.-Uses: Display the spell's range.

docs.title: Synced Settings
docs.text:
You can synchronize setting across multiple buttons on the same page, where a page is all the buttons that are currently visible on the device. If two buttons have Sync Type & Filter selected, and you change one of the filter settings on one, the otheer button will also be changed.

Each of the modes have a Set Type & Filter Sync setting. If you press this button, all buttons with Syn Type & Filter will have their settings changed to what you have configured for the Set Type & Filter Sync button.

docs.title: Offset
docs.text:
Offsets can be used in combination with the Select by Nr Selection Mode. By setting an offset, you increase Nr for all buttons with that offset.

For example, say you have 9 Inventory Mode buttons, with Nr set from 1 to 9. If you then set the offset to 9, it will display items 10 - 19.

Option Description Offset Mode Sets how to set the offset:-Set to Value: Sets the offset to the value set in Offset.-Increase/Decrease: Increases the offset by the value set in Offset. Offset The value to set the offset to (in case of Set to Value), or the value to increment the offset with (in case of Increase/Decrease). The offset can be any value, positive or negative. Display -Offset: Display the current offset on the Stream Deck.-Icon: Display an icon on the Stream Deck. Colors -On Color: (Set to Value only) A border is drawn on the Stream Deck of this color if the current offset is equal to the offset configured in Offset.-Off Color: (Set to Value only) A border is drawn on the Stream Deck of this color if the current offset is not equal to the offset configured in Offset.-Background: Background color of the button.
